title: ACCOUNTING
de_requirements:
·         ND Lower credit

·         Two (2) A’ level subjects including Accounting and either Economics or Business Management

·         JUPEB

Special consideration

B.Sc. with a minimum of 22 or HND with lower credit in any social science discipline

Caveat: Candidate must meet O’ level requirements for direct entry.

subjects: Use of English, Mathematics, Economics and any other social science subject.

title: ANATOMY

iv     Credit passes in all the required O’ level subjects in addition to all the above.

subjects: Use of English, Biology, Chemistry and Physics

ND/HND upper credits in relevant field.

subjects: Physics, Mathematics, and any of Chemistry, Geography, Art, Biology and Economics.

title: CRIMINOLOGY & SECURITY STUDIES
de_requirements: All candidates seeking admission by Direct Entry (DE) into the 200 Level must have Advanced Level or its approved equivalent with at least Credit level passes in at least two (2) social science subjects, one of which must be Government. Candidates with acceptable pass in JUBEB and Upper Credit in Ordinary National Diploma (OND) and Higher National Diploma (HND) from approved Polytechnic and Monotechnic Diploma-Awarding Institutions and/or their approved equivalent in the following disciplines: Peaceand Conflict Studies, Criminal Justice Administration, Paralegal Studies, Social Policy, Public Administration, Law, Security and Intelligence, and other related disciplines as well as First Degree in any discipline are also eligible for admission through DE, in addition to satisfying the O’Level minimum requirements. In addition, a minimum of 12 years of practical experience in related fields such as military, police and other State law enforcement agencies, in addition to satisfying the basic O’Level requirements, may be considered for admission into DE—the Officer must be in active service and not below the rank of Major or its equivalent.
utme_requirements: For admission into the four-year-degree programme in Criminology and Security Studies, a candidate must have Senior Secondary School Certificate Examination (SSCE) or its equivalent with at least credit level passes in five (5) subjects: English Language, Mathematics, Government, and any other two subjects from: Geography, Economics, History, Civic Education, Financial Accounting, Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Christian Religious Knowledge, French, and Nigerian Languages (i.e. Hausa, Igbo or Yoruba) at not more than two sittings. The candidate must also earn an acceptable score in the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME).
subjects: The required UTME subjects are English Language, Government, and any other two subjects from either of Life/Health Sciences, Behavioural/Social Sciences or Arts/Humanities background.

title: ECONOMICS
de_requirements:
Candidates seeking Direct Entry admission into the 200level of the B.Sc. Economics degree program shall possess any of the following qualifications:

a.     GCE Advanced level passes in at least two subjects which must include Economics.

b.     Acceptable passes in JUPEB or its equivalent;

c.      National Diploma Upper Credit or its equivalent in a related field.

d.     Higher National Diploma (HND) Lower Credit in a related field.

e.     NCE credit or its equivalent in related field;

f.    First degree in a related area from a
utme_requirements: Credit Passes in English, Mathematics, Economics and any two relevant subjects from the following: Further mathematics, Government, Accounting, Geography, Lit. in English, Commerce, Book Keeping, Civic Education, History, CRK/IRK, any Nigerian Language/French, Physics, Chemistry
subjects: Use of English, Mathematics, Economics and any one of the Further Mathematics, Government, Accounting, Geography, Lit. in English, commerce, Book Keeping, Civic Education, History, CRK/IRK

title: EDUCATIONAL MANAGEMENT
de_requirements:
Candidates for Direct Entry admission into three years degree programme in Educational Management will join the programme at 200 level. They would possess any of the following qualifications in addition to the basic university admission requirements of the subject area departments whose courses would be considered as restricted electives.

1.Two passes in relevant subject areas at advanced level, with SSCE/GCE “O” level credit pass in 5 subjects including English and Mathematics at not more than two sittings, OR

2. A two year diploma of a recognized institution in Nigeria or overseas with pass level not below merit.

3. At least a merit pass in two major subjects in relevant areas at NCE from recognized institution in Nigeria or overseas.
utme_requirements: Five (5) SSCE credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, and three other relevant subjects
subjects: Economics, Mathematics and one (1) other Social Science/Arts subject.

utme_requirements: Five (5) SSC credit passes to include English Language and CRS/IRS.
subjects: CRS/IRS and any other two (2) subjects.

title: SOCIOLOGY
de_requirements: Two Advance Level Credit Passes in Government and any other Social Science subject in addition to the stipulated five credit passes basic requirement at O’Level
utme_requirements: Five (5) SSCE Credit passes in English Language Mathematics, Government/Economics, Geography and any other two (2) Subjects
subjects: Government, Economics and any other Art or Social Science Subjects

title: STATISTICS
utme_requirements: Credit Passes in English Language, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry, Economics and/or Geography
subjects: Use of English, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry/Economics

title: SURVEYING AND GEOINFORMATICS
de_requirements:
(i)       Two (2) 'A' Level passes chosen from Mathematics or Physics and Chemistry, Geography or Fine Arts.

ND/HND upper credits in relevant field.
utme_requirements: Five (5) SSC credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry and any of Fine Art, Geography or Wood Work, Biology, Economics, Technical Drawing, Further. Mathematics., Introduction to Building Construction, Bricklaying/Block laying, Concreting, Wall, Floors and Ceiling Finishing, Joinery, Carpentary, Decorative Painting, Lining, Sign and Design, Wall Hanging, Colour Mixing/Matching and Glazing, Ceramics, Graphics Design, Graphic Printing, Basic Electricity.
subjects: Physics, Mathematics, and any of Chemistry, Geography, Art, Biology and Economics.

title: VISUAL & APPLIED ARTS
de_requirements:
(i)         Two (2) ‘A’ Level passes in Arts or Fine Arts and any other subject.

ND upper credit HND lower credit from recognised institutions.
utme_requirements:
Five (5) SSC credit passes to include English Language and Fine Arts.

For holders of NTC, the relevant subjects could be General Wood work, Building/Engineering Drawing, Introduction to Building Construction; Decorative Painting; Spray Painting, Lining, Sign and Design; Wall hanging, Colour Mixing/Matching and Glazing; Printing Origination; Machine Printing and Finishing; General Metal Work, Basic Electricity, Spinning, Weaving, Surface Design and Printing; Bleaching, Dyeing and Finishing; Graphic Design; Graphic

Printing and Ceramics.
subjects: Fine Arts and two (2) other Arts subjects or Social Science subjects.

title: ZOOLOGY
de_requirements: Two (2) 'A' Level passes or NCE in Biology, Zoology or Botany and one other Science subject
utme_requirements: Five (5) SSC credit passes in English Language, Mathematics, Biology and two (2) other Science subject.
subjects: Biology and any two (2) of Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics.
